datafield.subfield: The Allied creation of the postwar status of Berlin, 1970

Records of U.S. Occupation Headquarters, World War II page (European Advisory Commission (EAC); established by a secret protocol signed by the U.S., United Kingdom, and USSR representatives at the Tripartite Conference in Moscow, Nov. 1, 1943 with responsibility for making recommendations to the three Allied governments on questions concerning the surrender terms for, and postwar administration of, Germany and Austria, and the armistice terms for Bulgaria; abolished Sept. 10, 1945 pursuant to Section 1 of the Protocol of the Proceedings of the Potsdam Conference)
